intro: Pedicularis daltonii, commonly known as Dalton's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The species is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
